body_html: I think a generic "device-side assert triggered: perhaps you have an out-of-bounds index? try running on CPU" would be a good first step. Chainer has a full-fledged debug mode that catches OOB and NaNs, but I don't think that provides all that much that running on CPU wouldn't.
body_text: I think a generic "device-side assert triggered: perhaps you have an out-of-bounds index? try running on CPU" would be a good first step. Chainer has a full-fledged debug mode that catches OOB and NaNs, but I don't think that provides all that much that running on CPU wouldn't.
body: I think a generic "device-side assert triggered: perhaps you have an out-of-bounds index? try running on CPU" would be a good first step. Chainer has a full-fledged debug mode that catches OOB and NaNs, but I don't think that provides all that much that running on CPU wouldn't.
